title: introduction
text: retrieve list tables: retrieve dataflow info:
code: dfs <- list_dataflows() dfs[, 1:5] |>    head() #>   agencyID             id version #> 1      NL1 DF_TESTSET_X01     1.0 #> 2      NL1 DF_TESTSET_X02     1.0 #> 3 NL1.CNVT       DF_00370     1.0 #> 4 NL1.CNVT    DF_03726ned     1.0 #> 5 NL1.CNVT       DF_03761     1.0 #> 6 NL1.CNVT       DF_03777     1.0 #>                                                                          name #> 1                                       TESTSET (dataflow, only for TESTSET!) #> 2                                       TESTSET (dataflow, only for TESTSET!) #> 3 Redenen die een belangrijke rol speelden om uit huis gaan (OG'98),1960-1969 #> 4                                Prognose bevolking; kerncijfers, 2003 - 2009 #> 5                     Verkiezingsuitslag en zetelverdeling Tweede Kamer, 1963 #> 6                                                                Woonuitgaven #>   description #> 1        <NA> #> 2        <NA> #> 3        <NA> #> 4        <NA> #> 5        <NA> #> 6        <NA> ref <- dfs$ref[4] print(ref) #> [1] "NL1.CNVT:DF_03726ned(1.0)"  df <- get_dataflow_structure(ref = ref) df #> Dataflow: [NL1.CNVT:DF_03726ned(1.0)] #>   "Prognose bevolking; kerncijfers, 2003 - 2009" #>   agency: "NL1.CNVT", id: "DF_03726ned", version: "1.0" #>  #> Observation columns:  #>   "Topics", "Perioden", "OBS_VALUE", "UNIT_MEASURE", "UNIT_MULT", "OBS_MISSING", "DECIMALS", "OBS_STATUS" #>  #> Get a default selection of the observations with: #>   obs <- get_observations(id="DF_03726ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT") #> Get a default selection of the data with: #>   dat <- get_data(id="DF_03726ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT", pivot="Perioden") #>  #>  #> Properties: #>  $id, $agencyID, $version, $name, $description, $dimensions, $measure, $attributes, $columns, $ref, $flowRef, $raw_sdmx, $default_selection obs <-   obs <- get_observations(id="DF_37230ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT") #>  #> * `filter_on` argument not specified, using default selection: #>    filter_on = list( #>   Perioden = c("2003JJ00", "2004JJ00", "2005JJ00", "2006JJ00", "2007JJ00", "2008JJ00", "2009JJ00"), #>   Topics = c("TotaleBevolking_1", "k_0Tot20Jaar_2", "k_20Tot65Jaar_3", "k_65JaarOfOuder_4", "k_0Tot20Jaar_5", "k_20Tot65Jaar_6", "k_65JaarOfOuder_7", "DemografischeDruk_8", "Levendgeborenen_9", "TotaalVruchtbaarheidscijfer_10", "Overledenen_11", "LevensverwachtingMannen_12", "LevensverwachtingVrouwen_13", "Immigratie_14", "EmigratieInclSaldoAdmCorrecties_15", "MigratiesaldoInclSaldoAdmCorr_16") #>    ) #> *  To select all data, set `filter_on` to `NULL`. head(obs) #>                                    Topics Perioden  OBS_VALUE UNIT_MEASURE #> 1                      Demografische druk     2004      0.624     absoluut #> 2                        65 jaar of ouder     2006     14.200            % #> 3                             Overledenen     2005 145188.000     absoluut #> 4                           0 tot 20 jaar     2005     24.500            % #> 5 Emigratie (incl. saldo adm. correcties)     2007  91274.000     absoluut #> 6                        65 jaar of ouder     2009     14.700            % #>   UNIT_MULT          OBS_MISSING #> 1  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 2  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 3  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 4  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 5  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 6  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #>                                                     DECIMALS OBS_STATUS #> 1                               het cijfer heeft 3 decimalen Definitief #> 2                                het cijfer heeft 1 decimaal Definitief #> 3 het cijfer heeft 0 decimalen of  of de waarde is een tekst Definitief #> 4                                het cijfer heeft 1 decimaal Definitief #> 5 het cijfer heeft 0 decimalen of  of de waarde is een tekst Definitief #> 6                                het cijfer heeft 1 decimaal Definitief

title: Authors and Citation
text: Edwin de Jonge. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: de Jonge E (2025). sdmxdata: Open Data SDMX API Client. R package version 0.2.9000, https://edwindj.github.io/sdmxdata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sdmxdata: Open Data SDMX API Client},   author = {Edwin {de Jonge}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.9000},   url = {https://edwindj.github.io/sdmxdata/}, }

title: Open Data SDMX API Client
text: Work progress, used production work sdmxdata? package designed provide simple interface retrieve select data open statistical data providers support SDMX v2.1 REST API. focusses : retrieving lists dataflows: list_dataflows, getting overview available tables (aka dataflows) data provider, including descriptions. retrieving structure dataflow: get_dataflow_structure, getting detailed information structure metadata dataflow. retrieving data: get_data get_observations selecting retrieving data dataflow. functions allow easy filtering dimensions, reporting periods, metadata. retrieving lists agencies subagencies: list_agencies, getting overview agencies. implement full fledged SDMX metadata model data model. , can use rsdmx.

title: Open Data SDMX API Client
text: can install development version sdmxdata GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("edwindj/sdmxdata")

title: Open Data SDMX API Client
text: retrieve list tables: retrieve dataflow structure: retrieve data use get_data get underlying observations get_observations retrieve list agencies subagencies:
code: library(sdmxdata) CBSbeta <- sdmxdata::get_endpoint("NL1") dfs <- CBSbeta |> list_dataflows() dfs[,1:5] |>    head() #>   agencyID             id version #> 1      NL1 DF_TESTSET_X01     1.0 #> 2      NL1 DF_TESTSET_X02     1.0 #> 3 NL1.CNVT       DF_00370     1.0 #> 4 NL1.CNVT    DF_03726ned     1.0 #> 5 NL1.CNVT       DF_03761     1.0 #> 6 NL1.CNVT       DF_03777     1.0 #>                                                                          name #> 1                                    TESTSET (dataflow, alleen voor TESTSET!) #> 2                                    TESTSET (dataflow, alleen voor TESTSET!) #> 3 Redenen die een belangrijke rol speelden om uit huis gaan (OG'98),1960-1969 #> 4                                Prognose bevolking; kerncijfers, 2003 - 2009 #> 5                     Verkiezingsuitslag en zetelverdeling Tweede Kamer, 1963 #> 6                                                                Woonuitgaven #>   description #> 1        <NA> #> 2        <NA> #> 3        <NA> #> 4        <NA> #> 5        <NA> #> 6        <NA> OECD <- sdmxdata::get_endpoint("OECD") dfs_oecd <- OECD |> list_dataflows() dfs_oecd[,1:5] |>    head() #>       agencyID                            id version #> 1        ESTAT                    SEEA_AEA_A     1.4 #> 2 OECD.CFE.EDS DSD_FUA_CLIM@DF_COASTAL_FLOOD     1.1 #> 3 OECD.CFE.EDS         DSD_FUA_CLIM@DF_FIRES     1.1 #> 4 OECD.CFE.EDS   DSD_FUA_CLIM@DF_HEAT_STRESS     1.1 #> 5 OECD.CFE.EDS        DSD_FUA_CLIM@DF_PRECIP     1.1 #> 6 OECD.CFE.EDS   DSD_FUA_CLIM@DF_RIVER_FLOOD     1.1 #>                                 name description #> 1             Air Emissions Accounts        <NA> #> 2 Coastal flooding - Cities and FUAs        <NA> #> 3        Wildfires - Cities and FUAs        <NA> #> 4      Heat stress - Cities and FUAs        <NA> #> 5               Precipitation - FUAs        <NA> #> 6   River flooding - Cities and FUAs        <NA> dataflow_ref <- dfs$ref[4] print(dataflow_ref) #> [1] "NL1.CNVT:DF_03726ned(1.0)"  dsd <- CBSbeta |> get_dataflow_structure(ref = dataflow_ref) dsd #> Dataflow: [NL1.CNVT:DF_03726ned(1.0)] #>   "Prognose bevolking; kerncijfers, 2003 - 2009" #>   agency: "NL1.CNVT", id: "DF_03726ned", version: "1.0" #>  #> Observation columns:  #>   "Topics", "Perioden", "OBS_VALUE", "UNIT_MEASURE", "UNIT_MULT", "OBS_MISSING", "DECIMALS", "OBS_STATUS" #>  #> Get a default selection of the observations with: #>   obs <- CBSbeta |> get_observations(id="DF_03726ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT") #> Get a default selection of the data with: #>   dat <- CBSbeta |> get_data(id="DF_03726ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT", pivot="Perioden") #>  #>  #> Properties: #>  $id, $agencyID, $version, $name, $description, $dimensions, $measure, $attributes, $columns, $ref, $flowRef, $raw_sdmx, $default_selection data <- CBSbeta |> get_data(agencyID=dsd$agencyID, id = dsd$id, pivot="Topics") #>  #> * `filter_on` argument not specified, using default selection: #>    filter_on = list( #>   Perioden = c("2003JJ00", "2004JJ00", "2005JJ00", "2006JJ00", "2007JJ00", "2008JJ00", "2009JJ00"), #>   Topics = c("TotaleBevolking_1", "k_0Tot20Jaar_2", "k_20Tot65Jaar_3", "k_65JaarOfOuder_4", "k_0Tot20Jaar_5", "k_20Tot65Jaar_6", "k_65JaarOfOuder_7", "DemografischeDruk_8", "Levendgeborenen_9", "TotaalVruchtbaarheidscijfer_10", "Overledenen_11", "LevensverwachtingMannen_12", "LevensverwachtingVrouwen_13", "Immigratie_14", "EmigratieInclSaldoAdmCorrecties_15", "MigratiesaldoInclSaldoAdmCorr_16") #>    ) #> *  To select all data, set `filter_on` to `NULL`. head(data) #>   Perioden Topics:DemografischeDruk_8 Topics:EmigratieInclSaldoAdmCorrecties_15 #> 1     2003                      0.619                                    102102 #> 2     2004                      0.624                                    102058 #> 3     2005                      0.627                                    102025 #> 4     2006                      0.631                                     97598 #> 5     2007                      0.632                                     91274 #> 6     2008                      0.634                                     88016 #>   Topics:Immigratie_14 Topics:Levendgeborenen_9 #> 1               102095                   203607 #> 2               100019                   196965 #> 3               100086 Topics:LevensverwachtingMannen_12 Topics:LevensverwachtingVrouwen_13 #> 1                             76.15                              80.75 #> 2                             76.38 Topics:TotaalVruchtbaarheidscijfer_10 Topics:TotaleBevolking_1 #> 1                                  1.78                 16192572 #> 2                                  1.75                 16257694 #> 3                                  1.75                 16312831 #> 4                                  1.76                 16361819 #> 5                                  1.76                 16413373 #> 6                                  1.76                 16469770 #>   Topics:k_0Tot20Jaar_2 Topics:k_0Tot20Jaar_5 Topics:k_20Tot65Jaar_3 #> 1               3968999                  24.5 Topics:k_20Tot65Jaar_6 Topics:k_65JaarOfOuder_4 Topics:k_65JaarOfOuder_7 #> 1                   61.8                  2220456                     13.7 #> 2                   61.6                  2251256                     13.8 #> 3                   61.4                  2284208                       14 #> 4                   61.3                  2320240                     14.2 #> 5 agencyID="NL1.CNVT") #>  #> * `filter_on` argument not specified, using default selection: #>    filter_on = list( #>   Perioden = c("2024MM01", "2024MM02", "2024MM03", "2024MM04", "2024MM05", "2024MM06", "2024MM07", "2024MM08", "2024MM09", "2024MM10", "2024MM11", "2024MM12", "2024JJ00"), #>   RegioS = "NL01" #>    ) #> *  To select all data, set `filter_on` to `NULL`. head(obs) #>      RegioS     Perioden                                   Topics   OBS_VALUE #> 1 Nederland 2024 januari                              Overledenen    16825.00 #> 2 Nederland 2024 januari                  Levend geboren kinderen    13582.00 #> 3 Nederland 2024 januari   Bevolking aan het begin van de periode 17942942.00 #> 4 Nederland         2024   Bevolking aan het einde van de periode 18045532.00 #> list_agencies() head(agencies) #>     id                              name description      ref #> 1 HEAL       CBS (Gezondheid en Welzijn)        <NA> NL1.HEAL #> 2 POPU                   CBS (Bevolking)        <NA> NL1.POPU #> 3 LABO CBS (Arbeid en sociale zekerheid)        <NA> NL1.LABO #> 4 EDUC                   CBS (Onderwijs)        <NA> NL1.EDUC #> 5 INCO      CBS (Inkomen en bestedingen)        <NA> NL1.INCO #> 6 HOUS             CBS (Bouwen en wonen)        <NA> NL1.HOUS

what: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: Create : known endpoint endpoints use get_endpoint(). unlisted SDMX 2.1 REST endpoint use sdmx_endpoint(). new SDMX endpoint use SDMXEndpoint$new(). Base class SDMX endpoints

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: req httr2::request() object, can adjusted add headers proxy settings version character, SDMX version endpoint id character, id endpoint name character, name endpoint url character, url endpoint verbose logical, TRUE print information connection cache_dir character, directory cache metadata language character, language use text used response

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: SDMXEndpoint$new() SDMXEndpoint$clone()

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: create new SDMXEndpoint object, see also sdmx_endpoint()

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
code: SDMXEndpoint$new(   url,   id = gsub("\\W+", "_", url),   name = url,   language = NULL,   cache_dir = file.path(tempdir(), "sdmxdata", id),   verbose = getOption("sdmxdata.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: url character, url endpoint id character, id endpoint name character, name endpoint language character, language use text used response cache_dir character, directory cache metadata verbose logical, TRUE print information connection

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: objects class cloneable method.

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
code: SDMXEndpoint$clone(deep = FALSE)

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: deep Whether make deep clone.

text: Retrieve data sdmx api return data.frame

code: # S3 method for class 'sdmx_v2_1_data_request' as.data.frame(x, row.names = NULL, optional = FALSE, ...)

title: Transform a SDMX data request into a data.frame — as.data.frame.sdmx_v2_1_data_request
text: x sdmx_v2_1_data_request() object row.names used optional used ... reserved future use

title: Transform a SDMX data request into a data.frame — as.data.frame.sdmx_v2_1_data_request
text: data.frame

title: Transform a SDMX data request into a data.frame — as.data.frame.sdmx_v2_1_data_request
code: if (interactive()){   dfs <- list_dataflows()    flowRef <- paste0(dfs[2, c("agencyID", "id", "version")], sep=",")    # json   d <-     sdmx_v2_1_data_request(flowRef = flowRef) |>     as.data.frame()  }

text: data.table

code: if (interactive()){   dfs <- list_dataflows()    flowRef <- paste0(dfs[2, c("agencyID", "id", "version")], sep=",")    # json   d <-     sdmx_v2_1_data_request(flowRef = flowRef) |>     as.data.frame()  }

what: Download the response of a request to a file — download_to

text: Download response request file

title: Download the response of a request to a file — download_to
text: x httr2 request object destfile character string path file save response ... saved future use

title: Download the response of a request to a file — download_to
text: Download response request file, allows different format specifications e.g. csv, json, xml

title: Endpoints with sdmx data — endpoints
text: data.frame several endpoints sdmx data

title: Endpoints with sdmx data — endpoints
code: endpoints

title: Endpoints with sdmx data — endpoints
text: data.frame columns: id - id endpoint name - name agency endpoint url - url endpoint language - default language endpoint

title: Endpoints with sdmx data — endpoints
code: data("endpoints") endpoints[, 1:3] #>      id                               name #> 1 ESTAT                           EUROSTAT #> 2   LU1                             STATEC #> 3   NL1 Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek #> 4  OECD                               OECD #> 5   ABS                          AUSTRALIA #> 6   BIS                                BIS #> 7   FAO                                FAO #> 8   ILO                                ILO #> 9    UN                                 UN #>                                                        url #> 1 https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/api/dissemination/sdmx/2.1 #> 2                           https://lustat.statec.lu/rest/ #> 3                        https://sdmx-api.beta.cbs.nl/rest #> 4                        https://sdmx.oecd.org/public/rest #> 5                         https://data.api.abs.gov.au/rest #> 6                             https://stats.bis.org/api/v1 #> 7            https://nsi-release-ro-statsuite.fao.org/rest #> 8                                https://sdmx.ilo.org/rest #> 9                              https://data.un.org/ws/rest  OECD <- get_endpoint("OECD") OECD$verbose <- TRUE list_oecd <- OECD |> list_dataflows(cache=TRUE) #> <sdmx_v2_1_structure_request/httr2_request> #> GET https://sdmx.oecd.org/public/rest/dataflow?detail=allstubs #> Headers: #> • Accept-Language: "en" #> • accept         : "application/vnd.sdmx.structure+json;version=1.0;" #> Body: empty #> [cache:add]: “/tmp/Rtmpmuafry/sdmxdata/OECD/sdmxdata/dataflows_en.json” #> Available dataflows: 1368 #> Agencies: “ESTAT”, “OECD.CFE.EDS”, “OECD.CFE.RDG”, “OECD.CFE.SMEE”, “OECD.CFE.TOU”, “OECD.CTP.TAV”, “OECD.CTP.TPS”, “OECD.DAF”, “OECD.DAF.CM”, “OECD.DAF.COMP”, “OECD.DAF.INV”, “OECD.DCD.FSD”, “OECD.DEV.EMEA”, “OECD.DEV.LAC”, “OECD.DEV.NPG”, “OECD.ECO.GCRD”, “OECD.ECO.MAD”, “OECD.ECO.MPD”, “OECD.EDU.IMEP”, “OECD.ELS.HD”, “OECD.ELS.IMD”, “OECD.ELS.JAI”, “OECD.ELS.SAE”, “OECD.ELS.SPD”, “OECD.ENV.EEI”, “OECD.ENV.EPI”, “OECD.GOV.GIP”, “OECD.GOV.PSI”, “OECD.ITF”, “OECD.SDD.NAD”, “OECD.SDD.NAD.SEEA”, “OECD.SDD.SDPS”, “OECD.SDD.STES”, “OECD.SDD.TPS”, “OECD.STI.DEP”, “OECD.STI.PIE”, “OECD.STI.STP”, “OECD.TAD.ADM”, “OECD.TAD.ARP”, “OECD.TAD.ATM”, “OECD.TAD.TPD”, “OECD.WISE.CWB”, “OECD.WISE.INE”, “OECD.WISE.RSB”, “OECD.WISE.WDP” #> Content languages: “en”, “fr”

what: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
title: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
text: Retrieve data SDMX data API. function retrieves data SDMX data API returns data.frame.

title: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
code: get_data(   endpoint = NULL,   agencyID,   id,   version = "latest",   ref = NULL,   startPeriod = NULL,   endPeriod = NULL,   filter_on = list(),   ...,   dim_contents = c("label", "both", "id"),   obs_value_numeric = TRUE,   raw = FALSE,   language = NULL,   cache = TRUE,   pivot = NULL,   verbose = getOption("sdmxdata.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
text: endpoint endpoint, url httr2::request() object. agencyID agency ID id id dataflow version version dataflow, default "latest" ref dataflow reference can used stead agencyID, id version startPeriod start period data returned, works dataflows explicit time dimension. endPeriod end period data returned, works dataflows explicit time dimension. filter_on named list filters apply data, specified list(), default selection, set NULL select . ... Additional parameters pass request dim_contents contents dimension columns, either "label", "id" "" obs_value_numeric OBS_VALUE column coerced numeric? Default TRUE raw TRUE return raw data.frame SDMX, otherwise data.frame processed language language metadata cache TRUE cache accompanying  meta data. pivot character name column pivot data . NULL (default) data returned long format. verbose TRUE print information request

title: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
text: data.frame

title: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
text: get_data similar get_observations(), differs two aspects: returns data columns, attribute columns can pivot observations, .e. can return data wide format, useful feature data multiple measures data presented time series.

what: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
title: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
text: Get information structure  dataflow. dataflow can identified using agencyID, id version using ref argument.

title: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
code: get_dataflow_structure(   endpoint = NULL,   agencyID = getOption("sdmxdata.agencyID", NULL),   id,   version = "latest",   ref,   language = getOption("sdmxdata.language"),   cache = TRUE,   verbose = getOption("sdmxdata.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
text: endpoint endpoint object can coerced SDMXEndpoint agencyID agency ID dataflow id id dataflow version version dataflow, defaults "latest" ref string flow reference, form "agencyID:id(version)". Overrules agencyID, id version arguments. language language metadata cache logical, TRUE cache metadata verbose print information console

title: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
text: list dataflow information

title: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
text: use cases agencyID id preferred, ref argument includes specific version number dataflow. specifying version number default latest version. desirable pin reference dataflow specific version, ref argument can used. ref argument can also found list_dataflows().

what: Connect to a SDMX endpoint — get_endpoint
title: Connect to a SDMX endpoint — get_endpoint
text: Connect SDMX endpoint

title: Connect to a SDMX endpoint — get_endpoint
code: get_endpoint(id, language = NULL, singleton = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Connect to a SDMX endpoint — get_endpoint
text: id character, id one available endpoints. language character, language use text used response. singleton logical, TRUE return object already exists verbose logical, TRUE print information dataflows.

title: Connect to a SDMX endpoint — get_endpoint
text: SDMXEndpoint object

title: Connect to a SDMX endpoint — get_endpoint

what: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
text: Get observations SDMX provider. retrieves data SDMX provider returns data.frame.

title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
code: get_observations(   endpoint = NULL,   agencyID,   id,   version = "latest",   ref = NULL,   startPeriod = NULL,   endPeriod = NULL,   filter_on = list(),   use_factor = TRUE,   ...,   language = NULL,   as.data.table = FALSE,   dim_contents = c("label", "both", "id"),   attributes_contents = c("label", "id", "both"),   obs_value_numeric = TRUE,   raw = FALSE,   drop_first_columns = !raw,   cache = TRUE,   verbose = getOption("sdmxdata.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
text: endpoint endpoint, url httr2::request() object. agencyID agency ID id id dataflow version version dataflow, default "latest" ref dataflow reference can used stead agencyID, id version startPeriod start period data returned, works dataflows explicit time dimension. endPeriod end period data returned, works dataflows explicit time dimension. filter_on named list filters apply data, specified list(), default selection, set NULL select . use_factor TRUE dimension attributes columns factors, otherwise character ... Additional parameters pass request language language metadata .data.table TRUE return data.table(), otherwise data.frame() dim_contents contents dimension columns, either "label", "id" "" attributes_contents contents attribute columns, either "label", "id" "" obs_value_numeric OBS_VALUE column coerced numeric? Default TRUE raw TRUE return raw data.frame SDMX, otherwise data.frame processed drop_first_columns first columns dropped? Default TRUE (raw) cache TRUE cache accompanying  meta data. verbose TRUE print information request

title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
text: data.frame() data.table::data.table() depending .data.table

title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
text: default dimension attribute columns recoded factors labels. can changed dim_contents attributes_contents arguments.

title: list the agencies of an endpoint — list_agencies

title: list the agencies of an endpoint — list_agencies
text: endpoint endpoint, url httr2::request() object. language language return data . raw TRUE return raw data. cache TRUE cache list agencies. verbose TRUE print information caching.

title: Get sdmx category schemes — list_categoryschemes
text: endpoint endpoint, url httr2::request() object. agencyID character string given agencyID. ... saved future use. language language use text used response. cache TRUE cache result. raw TRUE return raw data SDMX, otherwise data processed. verbose TRUE print information dataflows.

what: Create a new SDMX endpoint — sdmx_endpoint
title: Create a new SDMX endpoint — sdmx_endpoint
text: Create endpoint url httr2 request object

title: Create a new SDMX endpoint — sdmx_endpoint
code: sdmx_endpoint(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'character' sdmx_endpoint(   x,   id = gsub("\\W+", "_", x),   name = x,   language = NULL,   cache_dir = file.path(tempdir(), "sdmxdata", id),   verbose = getOption("sdmxdata.verbose", FALSE),   ... )  # S3 method for class 'httr2_request' sdmx_endpoint(x, ...)

title: Create a new SDMX endpoint — sdmx_endpoint
text: x endpoint httr2 request object ... saved future use id character, id endpoint name character, name endpoint language character, language use text used response cache_dir character, directory cache metadata verbose logical, TRUE print information connection

title: Create a new SDMX endpoint — sdmx_endpoint
text: SDMXEndpoint object

what: Request SDMX data using the SDMX REST API v2.1 — sdmx_v2_1_data_request
title: Request SDMX data using the SDMX REST API v2.1 — sdmx_v2_1_data_request
text: sdmx_v2_1_data_request wrapper around smdx rest api v2.1 used retrieve data api.

title: Request SDMX data using the SDMX REST API v2.1 — sdmx_v2_1_data_request
code: sdmx_v2_1_data_request(   endpoint = NULL,   resource = c("data", "metadata"),   flowRef = NULL,   key = NULL,   providerRef = NULL,   ...,   startPeriod = NULL,   endPeriod = NULL,   updatedAfter = NULL,   firstNObservations = NULL,   lastNObservations = NULL,   dimensionAtObservation = NULL,   detail = c("full", "dataonly", "serieskeysonly", "nodata"),   includeHistory = NULL,   labels = c("both", "id") )

title: Request SDMX data using the SDMX REST API v2.1 — sdmx_v2_1_data_request
text: endpoint endpoint object can coerced endpoint resource resource request. Either "data" "metadata" flowRef flow reference request, see details key key request, see details providerRef provider reference request, see details ... Additional parameters pass request startPeriod start period data returned endPeriod end period data returned updatedAfter return data updated date firstNObservations return first n observations lastNObservations return last n observations dimensionAtObservation dimensions observations returned detail detail data return. Either "full", "dataonly", "serieskeysonly" "nodata" includeHistory Include different versions data labels Include labels data, valid format "csv"

title: Request SDMX data using the SDMX REST API v2.1 — sdmx_v2_1_data_request
text: modified httr2::request() object

title: Retrieve sdmx structure — sdmx_v2_1_structure_request
text: Wrapper SDMX REST v2.1 interface structured information

title: Retrieve sdmx structure — sdmx_v2_1_structure_request
code: sdmx_v2_1_structure_request(   endpoint = NULL,   resource = "dataflow",   agencyID = NULL,   resourceID = NULL,   version = NULL,   itemID = NULL,   format = c("json", "xml"),   language = NULL,   ...,   detail = c("full", "allstubs", "referencestubs", "allcompletestubs",     "referencecompletestubs", "referencepartial"),   references = c("none", "parents", "parentsandsiblings", "children", "descendants",     "all") )

title: Retrieve sdmx structure — sdmx_v2_1_structure_request
text: endpoint endpoint object can coerced endpoint resource resource request. One "datastructure", "metadatastructure", "categoryscheme", "conceptscheme", "codelist", "hierarchicalcodelist", "organisationscheme", "agencyscheme", "dataproviderscheme", "dataconsumerscheme", "organisationunitscheme", "dataflow", "metadataflow", "reportingtaxonomy", "provisionagreement", "structureset", "process", "categorisation", "contentconstraint", "attachmentconstraint", "actualconstraint", "allowedconstraint", "structure", "transformationscheme", "rulesetscheme", "userdefinedoperatorscheme", "customtypescheme", "namepersonalisationscheme", "vtlmappingscheme" agencyID agency ID request resourceID resource ID request version version request itemID item ID request format format request. Either "json" "xml" language language use text used response ... saved future use detail detail data return. Either "full", "allstubs", "referencestubs", "allcompletestubs", "referencecompletestubs", "referencepartial" references references return. Either "none", "parents", "parentsandsiblings", "children", "descendants", ""

title: Retrieve sdmx structure — sdmx_v2_1_structure_request
text: modified httr2::request() object
